response_parsed.title: Containerizing Cron-Driven Tasks Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to utilize FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs, to containerize and manage cron-driven tasks within Python 3.12+ applications.
key_points: Set up a FastAPI project in Python 3.12+
Create an API endpoint to handle the cron job
Utilize Docker and Docker Compose for deployment
Run the application using Cron in the container

code_examples.code:
```
from fastapi import FastAPI, BackgroundTasks
app = FastAPI()
@app.post('/cron-task/')
def start_task(background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    background_tasks.add_task(my_cron_function)
``

```
docker build -t my-app .
docker run -d --name my-app-container my-app
``

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this guide.
FastAPI version 0.71.0 or higher is recommended.
caveats: Ensure Docker and Docker Compose are properly installed on your system before running the examples.
Secure your API endpoint to prevent unauthorized access to the cron job.
